title: Radical Orthodoxy Part 2: Participation in the Divine and the Nature or Substance of God's Promise
description:
Michael and I continue on with our discussion of Part 2 of the summary of Radical Orthodoxy, from the ideas of John Milbank and Catherine Pickstock.  Resources from our discussion follow.

Document on Radical Orthodoxy can be found here:  https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#search/mleighty%40gmail.com?projector=1

Paradox and Participation, especially 33:00 and ff. https://youtu.be/7altNtdQly8?t=1984

Robert Jenson lecture:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C5inULwpiJY&feature=emb_logo

Robert Jenson article, How the World Lost its Story:
https://www.firstthings.com/article/2010/03/how-the-world-lost-its-story

David Bentley Hart article about Robert Jenson
The Lively God of Robert Jenson
https://www.firstthings.com/article/2005/10/the-lively-god-of-robert-jenson

NOTES from the conversation:

Radical Orthodoxy attempts to bridge two extremes
The ancient idea of participation - via grace disclosing itself to us.
The attempt to come to the unity of knowledge and revelation without throwing away the good of what we've learned in modernity.
Salvation is not just an ark of safety but an actual unification with the Divine.
The mystery of unification in the sense that we divide in order to come back together.
The unexpected gift of post modernism in exposing the division as it increases our desire for unity.
The unity is not a one off - no before and no after - but rather the eternal oneness, the lamb slain before the foundation of the world who is also revealed to be the culmination.
Not only to save people, but the cosmos itself
"The door to hell is locked from the inside." The question becomes "Is my will strong enough to forever lock that door?"
The church is a vessel of salvation for ourselves and for others,
moving through Time.
God has created myriads of mediating structures to Himself.
Time is simultaneously a cyclical thing and a movement upwards.
All the beauty, glory and splendor of God is an event - Christ.
Metaphysics is connected to narrative. God lives with us into the future.
Story and Promise.
Every decisive event is unpredictable until it happens, then it becomes inevitable, and thus plays a chiastic role.
The paradox of the Father's eternal sacrifice in creation versus His impassibility.

hypostasis
Giving substance of reality to the Lord's guarantee to fulfill the faith He in births.
Christ is the exact representation of His nature, the exact expression of His substance.
A setting or placing under - the thing put under - the substructure - the foundation.

That which has a foundation, that which has actual existence, substance, real being.
The substantial quality or nature of a person or thing.
Hupostasis also has the meaning of confidence, assurance.

Metecho - to partake of, to participate, to belong to, to be in union with

Hebrew 2:14

Hope drives action, motivates it, reveals the promise of the future, the golden thread, while Faith acts to bring it about.
